SEARCH
Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tracker.model.log

Class CategoryLogTest

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_tracker.model.log.CategoryLogTest
public class CategoryLogTest extends Object
Test class for the CategoryLog. This class contains unit tests to verify the functionality of the CategoryLog class, including task management and duration calculations.
Author:
Priyanshu Dongre

  • Constructor Details

    • CategoryLogTest

      public CategoryLogTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()
      Sets up the CategoryLog instance and sample tasks before each test. Initializes the category variable to a new instance of CategoryLog and creates three sample Task instances.

    • testConstructor

      @Test public void testConstructor()
      Tests the constructor of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that the category name is set correctly and that an exception is thrown when a null name is provided.

    • testCompareTo

      @Test public void testCompareTo()
      Tests the compareTo method of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that the comparison between two CategoryLog instances works as expected based on their names.

    • testAddTask

      @Test public void testAddTask()
      Tests the addTask method of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that tasks can be added to the category and that the task count is updated correctly. Also tests the setTask method.

    • testRemoveTask

      @Test public void testRemoveTask()
      Tests the removeTask method of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that tasks can be removed from the category and that the correct task is returned. Also checks for exceptions when trying to remove a task from an invalid index.

    • testTaskAsArray

      @Test public void testTaskAsArray()
      Tests the getTasksAsArray method of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that the tasks in the category can be retrieved as a 2D array.

    • testGetMinDuration

      @Test public void testGetMinDuration()
      Tests the getMinDuration method of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that the minimum duration is correctly calculated when no tasks are present, after adding a task, and after adding a task with a shorter duration.

    • testGetMaxDuration

      @Test public void testGetMaxDuration()
      Tests the getMaxDuration method of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that the maximum duration is correctly calculated when no tasks are present, after adding a task, and after adding a task with a longer duration.

    • testGetAvgDuration

      @Test public void testGetAvgDuration()
      Tests the getAvgDuration method of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that the average duration is correctly calculated when no tasks are present, after adding tasks of the same duration, and after adding a task with a different duration.

    • testSetTask

      @Test public void testSetTask()
      Tests the setTask method of the CategoryLog class. Verifies that a task can be replaced at a specific index and that the new task is correctly retrieved.
